intro: Rhagodia congesta, commonly known as the clustered rampion, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbel-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Rhagodia congesta produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters.
